New CNO / COO has much more experience and expertise than previous DON's and is slowly transforming PCBH into a more modernized and efficient hospital. CNO also shows up most days before night shift leaves to round and talk with night staff - he also shows up early on snow days to brush all the PM staff cars off - genuinely care about all his employees

Compared to most other psych facilities (especially those not in Utah) PCBH has a very tolerable and manageable acuity load. The number of restraints, seclusions, and incidents of aggression are very low.

Staffing ratios can sometimes be difficult 
Paper charting
Growing pains w new policies / changes being made
